question: When is a p-n diode said to be forward biased?
option1: when p-side is connected to the positive terminal of the battery
option2: when n-side is connected to the positive terminal of the battery
option3: when p-side is connected to the negative terminal of the battery
answer: when p-side is connected to the positive terminal of the battery
explanation: When an external voltage V is applied across a semiconductor diode such that p-side is connected to the positive terminal of the battery and n- side to the negative terminal.
